titlestmt.titleproper: Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records TAM.565
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Peter M. Filardo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-03-29T20:02-0400

did.unittitle: Dan La Botz Socialist Party of Ohio U.S. Senate Campaign (2010) Records

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dan La Botz (1945- ) was the Socialist Party of Ohio's 2010 candidate for the U.S. Senate.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: peter.filardo@nyu.edu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection contains correspondence (with voters, government bodies, the mass media, other (progressive organizations, etc.), a campaign diary, materials relating to a compliant filed with the FCC (Federal Communications Commission), campaign literature and related printed ephemera, a book-length typescript "A Vision from the Heartland: Socialism for the 21st Century," and two DVDs containing television appearances and other events.
